name: Artificial structures affecting flow
functionStatement: "Integrates the range of ""typical"" flows experienced by other processes. Examines the degree to which upstream infrastructure or land uses have fundamentally altered flow regimes (e.g., hydropeaking, dams, withdrawals)."
descriptionMarkdown: Documents dams, weirs, levees, diversions, pumps, and returns that alter hydrograph timing, peaks, baseflow, or floodplain access.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Inventory dams, levees, and weirs along and upstream of the reach using available datasets and local layers.

levels.label: Optimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: No major regulating structures restricting flows.

levels.label: Suboptimal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Minor structure or structures with limited effect.

levels.label: Marginal
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Moderate structures that alter flood or baseflow patterns.

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Multiple or large structures that strongly flatten, block, or regulate flows.
